intro: Cyrtandra quisumbingii var. minor, commonly known as the Philippine cyrtandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the Philippines, particularly found in the mountainous regions of Luzon and Mindanao. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
